decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach alongside artifact synergies to combo off and win the game quickly. Tamiyo and Emry provide card selection and recursion, while Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble help to fuel the combo. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern, as well as removal such as Lightning Bolt. Urza's Saga and Mox Opal provide additional value and acceleration. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful win condition.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, leveraging Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and find combo pieces. The goal is to assemble a combination of Grinding Station, Mishra's Bauble, and Mox Opal to mill the opponent's library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Grapeshot. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Lightning Bolt and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and control the board while digging through the deck with cards like Preordain and Urza's Saga.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggression and utilizing creatures that can deal damage quickly. It also includes cards that provide additional utility and removal to maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and efficient spells while maintaining a presence on the battlefield. With a mix of combat tricks, removal, and creature synergy, this deck is designed to apply pressure early and maintain that momentum throughout the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard using Underworld Breach, along with Grinding Station as a win condition. The deck also includes various ways to cycle through the deck and find key pieces quickly, while also providing disruption and protection with cards like Thassa's Oracle, Pithing Needle, and Swan Song. The mana base is optimized for casting the colored spells needed to execute the combo efficiently. By combining card draw, graveyard recursion, and combo pieces, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and win the game.

The deck relies on a series of land ramp spells and bounce lands to quickly assemble the necessary resources to play Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. By efficiently searching for and utilizing key lands such as Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, the deck is able to quickly set up a powerful board state which can lead to explosive plays like Scapeshift. The deck excels at quickly generating mana and establishing a formidable battlefield presence, making it a potent threat in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to combo off and mill through the deck to find Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. It also utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to help dig through the deck and bring back key pieces from the graveyard. The Moxen provide fast mana acceleration while control elements like Pithing Needle and Lightning Bolt help disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to set up the combo quickly while controlling the board to secure a win.

This deck focuses on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to create a powerful combo with Underworld Breach. By utilizing various artifacts like Mox Amber and Mishra's Bauble, you can generate mana and card advantage to fuel the combo. Grinding Station is used to mill through your deck, while Malevolent Rumble and Grapeshot provide the finishing blow to your opponent. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Pithing Needle and Unholy Heat. Urza's Saga and Otawara, Soaring City provide additional utility and support for the combo strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to continuously loop through the graveyard, generating value and eventually winning the game by milling the opponent or using Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to generate card advantage and fuel the combo. The deck also includes a mix of artifact ramp and disruption, with cards like Mox Opal and Pithing Needle. Urza's Saga provides additional synergy and the ability to tutor for key pieces.

The deck relies on utilizing combo pieces like Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to create a loop that allows for a powerful win condition. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card advantage and selection, while Urza's Saga helps to search for key artifacts. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Lightning Bolt and Swan Song, as well as a few alternate win conditions like Thassa's Oracle. Overall, the deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on casting artifacts and using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast them from the graveyard, generating card advantage and eventually winning the game through a combo involving Grinding Station or Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help dig for combo pieces while Mox Opal and Mox Amber provide acceleration. Support cards like Lightning Bolt and Karn, the Great Creator help control the game until the combo can be assembled. Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble provide additional utility and card advantage.

The deck aims to utilize the Underworld Breach combo with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to create a loop that allows the player to cast spells from their graveyard. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection and grinding through the deck quickly, while Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for artifacts. The inclusion of Malevolent Rumble and Lightning Bolt allows for some interaction and removal, while the limited number of lands with various abilities helps ensure consistency and versatility in the deck's strategy.

This deck aims to utilize the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly loop cards from the graveyard, generating infinite mana and eventually winning the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck runs a lot of cheap artifacts and cantrips to fuel the combo, along with ways to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy involves setting up the combo pieces as quickly as possible while managing resources effectively to outmaneuver the opponent and secure the win.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Phelia, Emperor of Bones, and Ketramose, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It also utilizes flicker effects from cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate additional value from enter-the-battlefield effects. Additionally, the deck includes hate cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies. The goal is to prevent the opponent from executing their plan effectively while building your board presence and overwhelming them with efficient threats.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana and storm count to cast a lethal Grapeshot, with Ral, Monsoon Mage and Ruby Medallion providing key components. It utilizes rituals, cantrips, and Past in Flames to recur spells and maintain momentum. Valakut Awakening and Glimpse the Impossible help with card selection and digging for key pieces. The deck also includes Wish to tutor for specific answers, as well as Artist's Talent for additional card draw. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with fetch lands and a Sacred Foundry for color fixing.

The main idea of this deck is to mill the opponent's library as quickly as possible by maximizing the effects of cards such as Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Archive Trap, and Fractured Sanity. In addition to milling, the deck also includes control elements like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to deal with threats from the opponent. Surgical Extraction helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy by removing key cards from their graveyard. Tasha's Hideous Laughter is a powerful finisher that can exile the opponent's entire library if enough cards have been milled. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Preordain and Glimpse the Unthinkable to help ensure the combo pieces come together efficiently.

The key concept of the following deck is to utilize the UrzaTron lands to ramp up quickly and play powerful Eldrazi creatures and equipment to control the game. By using cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a board presence with cards like Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust helps to further control the battlefield and give the deck an advantage in 1 vs 1 matchups in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful land-based combo cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to accelerate land drops and generate lots of mana. By efficiently tutoring for key lands and creating land synergies, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence and win conditions like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. It also has protection and utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Urza's Saga to help control the game and ensure the combo pieces can come together smoothly.

Utilizing lands and ramp cards to quickly get out Primeval Titan and trigger landfall abilities for explosive plays. Using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Urza's Saga to generate additional advantage and combo off with cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to win the game quickly. The deck also includes utility lands and toolbox cards like Bojuka Bog and Expedition Map to disrupt opponents and find key pieces for the combo. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its pieces quickly and overwhelm opponents with a powerful and efficient win condition.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production and combo off with Primeval Titan to search for lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva to deal massive amounts of damage. It also includes cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful land interactions and efficient combo plays. Overall, it emphasizes fast mana generation, land tutoring, and explosive win conditions.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and support cards to overwhelm the opponent with an efficient and powerful offense. By utilizing a mix of direct damage spells, token generation, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a mana base designed for consistency and speed, the Boros Aggro archetype seeks to curve out smoothly and efficiently while maintaining a high level of aggression throughout the match.

This deck aims to generate immense card advantage and explosive plays through the combination of artifact synergy and graveyard recursion. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to fuel the graveyard with artifacts, and then utilizing Underworld Breach to cast those spells from the graveyard repeatedly, the deck looks to assemble a combo win condition using Grinding Station and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student or Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells to protect the combo and slow down the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach combo to quickly and efficiently mill through your deck, generate mana with artifacts like Mox Opal and Mox Amber, and recur key spells like Malevolent Rumble and Grapeshot. With cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student providing card advantage and utility, the deck aims to win through a combination of overwhelming board presence and direct damage. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble helps ensure consistency and acceleration in executing the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating card advantage and setting up a combo finish with cards like Malevolent Rumble or Grapeshot. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide recursion and card selection, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga offer additional synergy with the combo strategy. The deck also includes disruption tools like Lightning Bolt and Pithing Needle to control the board and protect the combo. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to loop through the graveyard and cast spells from there, including powerful combo pieces like Grinding Station and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It also includes various utility cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to help set up the combo and generate card advantage. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a game-winning loop with Underworld Breach.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces necessary to utilize Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to mill through the deck and win the game with the Thassa's Oracle win condition. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student are key pieces in enabling the combo, while Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Mox Amber provide the necessary acceleration. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Lightning Bolt, Swan Song, and Malevolent Rumble to protect the combo. Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and tutoring options for the combo pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Underworld Breach combo to generate a large amount of mana and continuously loop spells from the graveyard. Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and can help dig for combo pieces. Grinding Station is used to mill the opponent's deck or self-mill to set up the combo. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards to utilize the powerful effects of cards like Hollow One, Detective's Phoenix, and Dauthi Voidwalker. By using cards like Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting, the deck can quickly discard cards and bring out powerful creatures for aggressive plays. Utilizing fast lands like Blood Crypt and Bloodstained Mire, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast creatures and burn spells to secure victory quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with taxing effects. By utilizing powerful creatures like Phelia and Ketramose, along with disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Ephemerate, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while keeping their resources in check. The inclusion of cards like Relic of Progenitus and Solitude provide additional disruption and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the board throughout the game, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their strategy effectively.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting the opponent's resources through tax effects and graveyard hate. It combines powerful creatures with tools like Ephemerate for value plays and disruption spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to control the board through creatures like Flickerwisp and Solitude while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck's strategy relies on disrupting the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast clock to close out the game.

The deck aims to disrupt opponents with hand disruption, removal spells, and graveyard hate while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes the Death and Taxes archetype to slow down opponents through taxation effects while also utilizing aggressive creatures to close out games quickly. It also has some flicker effects to generate extra value from enter-the-battlefield abilities. The deck has a mix of control elements and aggro elements, making it versatile in different matchups. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game tempo and push for a quick victory.

This UB Mill deck focuses on aggressively milling the opponent's library using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Glimpse the Unthinkable while disrupting their plans with counterspells like Drown in the Loch and removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes Archive Trap and Surgical Extraction to punish opponents for searching their library. Tasha's Hideous Laughter can clear out large chunks of the opponent's library while Fractured Sanity helps to fill up their graveyard for more milling. Jace, the Perfected Mind can provide card advantage and alternate win condition while controlling the board.

This Modern UB Mill deck aims to win by milling the opponent's library as quickly and efficiently as possible. It utilizes cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Fractured Sanity to mill cards from the opponent's deck, while also using Archive Trap to mill even more cards when the opponent searches their library. The deck also includes disruption like Surgical Extraction and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board while milling. With the right combination of mill cards and disruption, this deck can quickly deplete the opponent's library and win the game through deck out.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creatures, supported by powerful spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing a variety of multi-colored creatures and spells, the deck can take advantage of different types of mana for flexibility and versatility in combat. The Leylines and Leyline Binding help control the board and protect key creatures, while the land base allows for consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of creatures, direct damage spells, and efficient mana usage to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and dealing damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. The inclusion of Leyline cards help to establish board control and protect key creatures. The deck also has some counter spells for protection and disruption. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production and combo off with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to quickly ramp into powerful land combos. The key strategy involves efficiently tutoring for key pieces like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle while leveraging land bounce effects from cards like Simic Growth Chamber to generate additional value. The goal is to create a powerful board state with strong land synergies while maintaining card advantage through efficient tutoring and ramping.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to power out Primeval Titan as early as possible. Once Primeval Titan is on the battlefield, the deck aims to search for lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove allows for additional land plays and combos, making the deck a powerful force in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cast powerful ramp spells like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. The key strategy is to use these tools to quickly assemble the combo of getting multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle triggers to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field to generate additional value and card advantage. With the right set-up, this deck can win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana acceleration while abusing the land tutor abilities of Primeval Titan. By quickly ramping into powerful lands such as Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with sizeable threats and game-winning combos. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith allows for versatile gameplay options, while the combination of different land types provides flexibility in executing the game plan effectively.

This Amulet Titan deck focuses on ramping quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield as soon as possible. Once Primeval Titan is in play, the deck utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to search for key combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Lotus Field to generate additional mana and combo off in explosive fashion. Overall, the key concept revolves around assembling the combo pieces efficiently and effectively to win the game.

The main theme of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and search for combo pieces to deploy Primeval Titan as soon as possible. With the help of Amulet of Vigor, the deck can generate huge amounts of mana and abuse the land toolbox to find specific answers or win conditions. The use of specific lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, along with cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith, allows the deck to pull off explosive combos and overwhelm the opponent in a single turn.

The deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing a mix of creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes cards that provide additional value, such as token generation and card advantage. The deck also includes ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Static Prison and Ranger-Captain of Eos. Overall, the key idea is to apply constant pressure on the opponent while maintaining board control and flexibility through a combination of creature aggression, burn spells, and disruptive elements.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures, efficient removal spells, and disruptive enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with support from cards like Ocelot Pride and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly. The inclusion of Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment adds disruption to control the opponent's board state and provide extra reach to finish off the opponent.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, utilizing artifacts such as Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch for card advantage and combo potential. Thassa's Oracle is the win condition, allowing the player to win the game when their library is empty. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card draw and filtering, while Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal help ramp and fix mana. The deck also includes disruption tools like Lightning Bolt and Swan Song to control the game state while assembling the combo pieces.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo using Underworld Breach to fill the graveyard with artifacts and then loop them back to generate a win condition. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and recursion, while Grinding Station serves as a key piece in the combo. Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal help with mana acceleration, and Urza's Saga provides additional artifact synergy. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Spell Snare to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' game plans.

The deck revolves around utilizing Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to continuously loop through the graveyard, casting spells multiple times to generate a massive amount of mana and combo off with Grinding Station or Grapeshot to win the game. The deck also includes tutors like Urza's Saga to find key pieces and interaction like Lightning Bolt and Swan Song to protect the combo. The goal is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck aims to quickly cycle through cards using a combination of Tamiyo, Mishra's Bauble, and Grinding Station to set up the combo with Underworld Breach and Thassa's Oracle. Emry and Mox Opal provide additional mana acceleration while Malevolent Rumble helps control the board. Urza's Saga can tutor for key artifacts like Grinding Station and Mox Opal. The deck is focused on executing the combo as efficiently as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan with control elements like Lightning Bolt and Sink into Stupor.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a powerful combo that allows for repetitive, explosive plays. By using cards like Tamiyo, Mishra's Bauble, and Emry to manipulate the graveyard and generate card advantage, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game in one explosive turn. With disruption elements like Lightning Bolt and Spell Snare, as well as additional win conditions like Thassa's Oracle, the deck is designed to be resilient against opposing strategies while remaining focused on its primary game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach along with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and various artifact cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate massive card advantage and loop spells from the graveyard. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection and filtering, while Thassa's Oracle can be used as a win condition. The deck also includes control elements like Lightning Bolt and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach alongside artifacts like Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to create a powerful combo that allows for repeated casting of spells from the graveyard. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage while Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble help generate mana and card draw. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while utilizing disruption like Spell Snare and Lightning Bolt to protect its game plan. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides further utility and enables the deck to quickly find key artifacts.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating value and overwhelming the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card selection and recursion, while Mishra's Bauble and Grinding Station provide additional combo pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and interaction like Lightning Bolt and Spell Pierce to control the game state. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game.

This deck focuses on setting up a powerful combo using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and help dig for combo pieces. Grinding Station is used to mill cards and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes various artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and trigger abilities. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure a win.

This deck utilizes the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with spell recursion. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station provide additional synergy with artifacts, enabling explosive turns and potential win conditions with Thassa's Oracle. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces, while the deck also includes disruption in the form of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swan Song. The deck's main goal is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently to win the game before the opponent can react.

The deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful combo using Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to fill the graveyard with artifacts and then mill the opponent's deck. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student are key pieces in recurring artifacts and generating card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Malevolent Rumble and Sink into Stupor to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to efficiently execute the combo while managing the opponent's resources to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly in order to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game. Using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate mana production, the deck aims to play big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker ahead of schedule. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator provide disruption and protection, while cards like Malevolent Rumble and Sowing Mycospawn help clear the opponent's board. Overall, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with strong Eldrazi creatures while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly summon powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield. It includes disruptive spells like Malevolent Rumble and control elements like Karn, the Great Creator to dominate the game. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats like Emrakul and World Breaker while maintaining control over the game with removal spells and mana acceleration. The strategy involves controlling the game early on and then rapidly deploying massive Eldrazi creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the board with disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production and play big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to remove threats from the opponent's side of the board. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption while Eldrazi Temple helps to cast the Eldrazi creatures more efficiently.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent through various forms of disruption such as removal spells, counterspells, and graveyard hate. It utilizes a mix of removal, card filtering, and powerful creatures to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with its creatures to ultimately win the game through incremental advantage and resource denial. It is a versatile and adaptable deck that can handle a variety of threats and strategies in a competitive Modern 1 vs 1 environment.

This deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, removal, hand disruption, and graveyard hate. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Psychic Frog to apply pressure and generate card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in fetching lands. Overall, this deck focuses on resource management and outlasting the opponent through a combination of disruption and threats.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Detective's Phoenix. The goal is to fill the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to bring out powerful threats like Hollow One and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Using cards like Lightning Bolt and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Nihil Spellbomb helps against graveyard strategies, while Arena of Glory provides a way to pump up the team and close out games quickly.

The Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature play, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes powerful spells like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to deal heavy damage. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment while maintaining card advantage with Ranger-Captain of Eos and Seasoned Pyromancer. With a mix of creatures, spells, and enchantments, this deck is designed to pressure the opponent and finish the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push. Utilizing Necrodominance and Soul Spike, you can drain your opponent's life total while generating value with Fell the Profane and Relic of Progenitus. Your creatures, including Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Ketramose, the New Dawn, provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt your opponent's game plan, leading to a fast and decisive victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting the opponent's game plan through tax effects and resource denial. By utilizing creatures with powerful abilities like flickering and graveyard hate, combined with removal spells and hand disruption, it aims to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. The deck also benefits from mana-efficient threats and synergies between its creatures, making it challenging for opponents to stabilize or recover once the deck is ahead. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly while hindering the opponent's options.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with taxing effects while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It aims to control the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, while also utilizing disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp and Witch Enchanter. Ketramose and Phelia provide a strong aggressive presence, supported by Emperor of Bones and Overlord creatures. The deck also includes graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus. Overall, the strategy revolves around using Death and Taxes elements to slow down opponents and push for a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck revolves around generating a high amount of mana through cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, while also utilizing card draw and selection to consistently find combo pieces like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The deck aims to cast multiple spells in a turn to build towards a lethal Grapeshot or other finisher, with Wrenn's Resolve providing protection for key pieces. Boseiju, Who Endures helps to ensure important spells resolve, making this deck a fast and explosive combo deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.
